# Georgia Senate PM Meeting - Day 33 (2025 Session)

## Overview
The Senate session featured extended debate and discussion on House Bill 55, which would add a new judgeship to the Alapaha Judicial Circuit. Senators engaged in a lively back-and-forth, showcasing their legislative expertise and knowledge of Georgia history and trivia.

## Key Actions
**HB 55**: Bill to add a new judgeship to the Alapaha Judicial Circuit, passed by substitute.

## Bills Introduced (First Reading)
- HB 111
- HB 1302 
- HB 161
- HB 111 (again)
- HB 112
- HB 1437

## Notable Moments
- Senators engaged in an entertaining exchange about the origins of the Alapaha River and blueberries.
- Senators discussed historical references like the "lean ox festival" and Elvis leaving the building.
- The Rules Committee Chairman was praised for his South Georgia roots and participation in local festivals.

## Votes
- HB 55 passed by a vote of 51-1.

## Attendance
A quorum was present, though some Senators briefly stepped away during the debate.

## Adjournment
The session was adjourned. The next session will be held on a future date.
